newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi Material 1st-half copper output seen down.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi Material 1st-half copper output seen down.

text.p: Mitsubishi Materials Corp, Japan's second-largest producer of refined copper, said on Tuesday its refined copper output in the first half of 1997/98 was expected to fall 6.3 percent to 23,250 tonnes per month from 24,813 tonnes in the year-ago period.

Output levels in the second half of 1996/97 and first half of 1997/98 were reduced due to a shut-down of the company's Naoshima copper smelter for scheduled maintenance from March 12 to April 20, a company spokeswoman said.

Mitsubishi Materials's scheduled output for the first half of fiscal 1997/98 and its schedule for the prior half-year were as follows (in tonnes per month, except for gold and silver in kilograms per month):
